response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 20 years old, the individual is very young which is statistically associated with higher recidivism risk."],
    ["Gender", "low", "Being female generally correlates with lower recidivism risk compared to males."],
    ["Ethnicity", "medium", "Hispanic ethnicity can interact with socio-economic factors, though it is not a direct risk indicator; it is weighted medium due to contextual social factors."],
    ["Arrest History", "medium", "Having one arrest, even without conviction, signals some level of involvement with the criminal justice system."],
    ["Conviction History", "low", "The absence of any conviction generally indicates a lower likelihood of reoffending."],
    ["Marital Status", "low", "Never having been married is not strongly associated with recidivism risk."],
    ["Living Arrangement", "low", "Not living alone suggests a support network, which tends to reduce reoffending risk."],
    ["Education", "low", "Having a high school diploma and being enrolled in college are positive factors that reduce recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment Stability", "medium", "Holding four jobs within a year may suggest some instability in employment, which can be a moderate risk factor."],
    ["Drug Usage", "low", "Past use of marijuana, while a risk factor for substance-related issues, is considered less severe compared to other drugs."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not feeling depressed in the past month indicates stable short-term mental health."],
    ["Childhood Environment", "medium", "Growing up in a larger household in an urban environment can be associated with elevated exposure to risk factors, while not determinative on its own."],
    ["Religious Beliefs", "medium", "A belief that God does not influence personal events might imply a lower reliance on community or spiritual support, contributing moderately to risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At 20 years old, the individual is very young which is statistically associated with higher recidivism risk.
Being female generally correlates with lower recidivism risk compared to males.
Hispanic ethnicity can interact with socio-economic factors, though it is not a direct risk indicator; it is weighted medium due to contextual social factors.
Having one arrest, even without conviction, signals some level of involvement with the criminal justice system.
The absence of any conviction generally indicates a lower likelihood of reoffending.
Never having been married is not strongly associated with recidivism risk.
Not living alone suggests a support network, which tends to reduce reoffending risk.
Having a high school diploma and being enrolled in college are positive factors that reduce recidivism risk.
Holding four jobs within a year may suggest some instability in employment, which can be a moderate risk factor.
Past use of marijuana, while a risk factor for substance-related issues, is considered less severe compared to other drugs.
Not feeling depressed in the past month indicates stable short-term mental health.
Growing up in a larger household in an urban environment can be associated with elevated exposure to risk factors, while not determinative on its own.
A belief that God does not influence personal events might imply a lower reliance on community or spiritual support, contributing moderately to risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old female who identifies herself as Hispanic. She has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. She is 5 feet 4 inches and weighs 145 lbs. She has never been married and is currently not living alone. She has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 2-year college. She has held 4 jobs during the year. She has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, she lived with her biological mother in a household of size 7, in an urban area. She considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
